Reviews.Title: My first digital camera purchase.
Reviews.Author: David R. Serna "Sern-Dog"
Reviews.Content: I have owned two other 35mm cameras from Minolta, and wanted a digital camera from Sony. So far so good; no problems other than the  battery has a short life. It drained completely when we were up in the mountains camping. No outlets anywhere, of course. Couldn't recharge it. Camera is very good, though.

Reviews.Title: great first dlsr
Reviews.Author: ksvecz
Reviews.Content: This was my first dslr and it was fantastic, very durable (it has taken quite a few hits and splashes) great image quality, very light, and fits the hand like a glove. And its innovations are only now being taken up by larger players (Canon and Nikon) and that's what i think Sony is great for. but not practical to stick with if one is going to go pro, i myself am moving onto canon. although, for any level amateur Sony is a good route. unfortunately poor low light performance even with high iso such as 3200 in this camera, and the on camera flash stinks. ive had mine since 2009 (its now 2013) and its held up great and has to have close to 100k actuations on it and going strong. I just wish Sony offered more competitive high end cameras. I truly believe Sony will continue to lead in tangential innovations, just watch Canon and Nikon pick them up. Great camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.2-megapixel APS-size CCD image sensor for ultra-fine detail
SteadyShot INSIDE in-camera image stabilization; Eye-Start Autofocus
Tiltable, 2.7-inch Clear Photo LCD Plus display (upward by up to 135 degrees, downward by up to 55 degrees)
Compatible with high-capacity Memory Stick PRO Duo, Memory Stick PRO-HG Duo and SD/SDHC media (sold separately)
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Alpha A330 10.2 MP Digital SLR Camera with Super SteadyShot INSIDE Image Stabilization (Body)
